page.title: 07Transport in General
page.content: This is a rural area and the main transport is{privately owned motor- {cars}and{public services,}travelling along well surfaced tarmac-ed roads. There are two{A}category roads __ the{A 40}runs from South to North to Fishguard & the{A 487}runs from the South-east to St.David's, situated at the 'coastal tip' of South-west Wales. The only{B}road __{B 4329,}runs South-east to North-east to Cardigan. Roads are well sign-posted with large modern sign-posts on the main roads showing reference numbers and mileage; on the side roads and lanes are clearly seen finger-posts. We went and visited an old{mile-stone}on the Fishguard Rd. showing miles and yards. Some Nationalists daub signs green; or paint on the{'Welsh' place-names.} A small{civil air-field}is in the North-east corner of our project area.
